page.title: 05R.A.F. Linton-on-Ouse.
page.content: R.A.F. Linton-on-Ouse was built as an airfield in 1930,flying Whitley, Halifax and Lancaster bombers during the Second World War.In 1957 it became home of No.1 Flying Training School training R.A.F. students and officers from Commonwealth and Foreign forces. In the Flying Training Wing are three Squadrons,where students are trained in all aspects of flying Jet Provosts, including aerobatics, navigation, formation,night and instrument flying. Operation and Bulldog Flying Training Squadron consists of Air Traffic Control,Fire and Meteorological Sections and Administrative Wing.The Department of the Environment is responsible for the maintenance of the airfield and station buildings.Airwork Ltd.,a private firm,is responsible for the Engineering Wing and Supply Facilities.
